tool.name: ZoomToMapNumber

param.name: mapnumber
param.dialogReference:
Select a map number or type one in. Note that the map number will have a suffix if it's for a "detail map".

If you type an unrecognized number, you will be presented an error message with a list of EVERY map number. Not very useful but I don't have control over that!

tool.summary:
Sets up the map to show a selected map number.

Uses the CURRENT map document, so it only works if you run it in ArcMap with a valid map document open.
tool.usage:
Select a map number (or type one in) and then click OK. The tool will adjust the main dataframe view to the selected map, and update other items including title, scalebar, locator maps, cancelled taxlot numbers, and "plot date".

This tool relies on "Data Driven Pages". You can also change the view using the DDP tools too, but the related information (titles etc) won't be updated.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Sets up the map to show a selected map number.

Uses the CURRENT map document, so it only works if you run it in ArcMap with a valid map document open.
